alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 6:48PM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Cache River Near Patterson affecting Woodruff and Jackson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cache River Near Patterson. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Pastureland and cropland not protected by levees in Jackson and Woodruff counties affected. Water is over portions of State Highway 37 and deep along the shoulders of State Highway 18 near Grubbs. Water over portions of Woodruff County Road 775 north of State Highway 260. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Monday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue rising to 9.6 feet early Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date Cache River Patterson 9.0 8.1 Mon 6 PM 8.9 9.4 9.4 Rising &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
